definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze

sentences.english: Hey, boss, you have the word fish ah?
sentences.chinese: 咦，老板，你这个鱼身上还有字啊？

sentences.english: "Why," said she, "Monsieur Jean has not been here today."
Hello, old chap, you got to work, hey?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，老伙计，你还得干活呀，咦？

sentences.english: The very next day wake up, oh, May the dragon boat how past? MS.
sentences.chinese: 第二天一醒，咦，五月端午咋就过去了呢？

sentences.english: Why, where is Amy's bottle of cologne?
sentences.chinese: 咦，艾美的那瓶古龙水呢？

sentences.english: Romantic energies are working to bring your true mate into your life.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫的能量正在咦鳎瑢⒄嬲闾H带入你的生命中。

sentences.english: Gee, do you think there's any problem?
There goes your pet, Sammy, eh?
sentences.chinese: 你那个宠物去了，桑未，咦？

sentences.english: why, there is nothing to prove that the general was murdered.
sentences.chinese: 咦，根本没有任何证据可以证明将军是被谋杀的呀。

sentences.english: Oh, what is that crumpled thing over there?
sentences.chinese: 咦，那边那个折折皱皱的东西是什么？

sentences.english: Why, the grottos--caves of the island.
Yi, ferial li of the most tightfisted sister bought a lot of guns.
sentences.chinese: 咦，平日里最舍不得花钱的妹妹，买了一大堆炮。

sentences.english: Yo-ho, that dog is eating the bone.
sentences.chinese: 咦，那只小狗狗在吃肉骨头呢。

definition: interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
variant of 怎麼了|怎么了[zen3 me5 le5]
can it be possible that/could it be
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
to cry out in alarm or surprise
